trans-unit.source: Multiple MSBuild project files found in '{0}'. Specify which to use with the --project option.
trans-unit.target: {0} obsahuje více souborů projektů MSBuild. Pomocí parametru --projekt zadejte, který soubor chcete použít.

trans-unit.source: Could not find a MSBuild project file in '{0}'. Specify which project to use with the --project option.
trans-unit.target: V {0} se nepovedlo najít soubor projektu MSBuild. Pomocí parametru --project zadejte, který projekt chcete použít.

trans-unit.source: The project file '{0}' does not exist.

trans-unit.target: Možnosti --quiet a --verbose se nedají zadat spolu.

trans-unit.source:
Environment variables:
DOTNET_USE_POLLING_FILE_WATCHER When set to '1' or 'true', dotnet-watch will poll the file system for changes. This is required for some file systems, such as network shares, Docker mounted volumes, and other virtual file systems.
DOTNET_WATCH dotnet-watch sets this variable to '1' on all child processes launched.
DOTNET_WATCH_ITERATION dotnet-watch sets this variable to '1' and increments by one each time a file is changed and the command is restarted.
DOTNET_WATCH_SUPPRESS_EMOJIS When set to '1' or 'true', dotnet-watch will not show emojis in the console output.
Remarks: The special option '--' is used to delimit the end of the options and the beginning of arguments that will be passed to the child dotnet process.
For example: dotnet watch -- --verbose run
Even though '--verbose' is an option dotnet-watch supports, the use of '--' indicates that '--verbose' should be treated instead as an argument for dotnet-run.
Examples: dotnet watch run dotnet watch test
trans-unit.target:
Environment variables:
DOTNET_USE_POLLING_FILE_WATCHER When set to '1' or 'true', dotnet-watch will poll the file system for changes. This is required for some file systems, such as network shares, Docker mounted volumes, and other virtual file systems.
DOTNET_WATCH dotnet-watch sets this variable to '1' on all child processes launched.
DOTNET_WATCH_ITERATION dotnet-watch sets this variable to '1' and increments by one each time a file is changed and the command is restarted.
DOTNET_WATCH_SUPPRESS_EMOJIS When set to '1' or 'true', dotnet-watch will not show emojis in the console output.
Remarks: The special option '--' is used to delimit the end of the options and the beginning of arguments that will be passed to the child dotnet process.
For example: dotnet watch -- --verbose run
Even though '--verbose' is an option dotnet-watch supports, the use of '--' indicates that '--verbose' should be treated instead as an argument for dotnet-run.
Examples: dotnet watch run dotnet watch test

trans-unit.source: Lists all discovered files without starting the watcher.
trans-unit.target: Lists all discovered files without starting the watcher.

trans-unit.source: Suppress hot reload for supported apps.
trans-unit.target: Suppress hot reload for supported apps.

trans-unit.source: Runs dotnet-watch in non-interactive mode. This option is only supported when running with Hot Reload enabled. Use this option to prevent console input from being captured.
trans-unit.target: Runs dotnet-watch in non-interactive mode. This option is only supported when running with Hot Reload enabled. Use this option to prevent console input from being captured.

trans-unit.source: Suppresses all output except warnings and errors
trans-unit.target: Suppresses all output except warnings and errors

trans-unit.source: Warning NETSDK1174: The abbreviation of -p for --project is deprecated. Please use --project.
trans-unit.target: Upozornění NETSDK1174: Zkratka -p pro --project je zastaralá. Použijte prosím --project.
